section.title: Purpose
section.p: Enables Bluetooth services to set appropriate security requirements that incoming connections to that service must meet. Security settings are simply whether authentication, authorisation, and/or encryption are required or not.
Note that the API only deals with incoming connections: for outgoing services, see How to use security on outgoing sockets.

section.title: Architectural relationships
section.p: The API uses the client/server framework. The API provides R classes that send requests to a server process that stores and manages security information.

section.title: Description
section.p: Before using the security manager, clients must open a session to it using RBTMan, and then a subsession using RBTSecuritySettings.
A security settings object, TBTServiceSecurity, is used to set whether authentication, authorisation, and/or encryption are required.
